poem:
**The Last Vote**

This time, he whispers,
at the pulpit,
promises laced with saccharine—  
a final click on the ballot box,
a nation sealed
in dusk's soft chains.
Four years—then silence.
The crowd, believing,
nods to sleepwalk through
the fields of locked gates,
into a twilight
where democracy dreams
of freedom past.
